DOCNAME: CASE OF PİROĞLU AND KARAKAYA v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 10;Violation of Art. 11;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim rejected;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of a violation sufficient;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Antonella Mularoni;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in GPE . They were members of the executive board of LOC of ORG ( “ the Association ” ) at the time of lodging their applications to the ORG . There were CARDINAL different sets of criminal proceedings brought against the applicants ; however , it should be noted that the first applicant 's case concerned only the first set of proceedings , regarding the ORG members with prior convictions .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE Governor sent a letter to the ORG requesting that the membership of CARDINAL persons , including the second applicant , be annulled as they were considered to be involved in illegal activities . In this letter it is said that , although the second applicant had been taken into police custody on DATE , she had subsequently been released as it had not been established that she had any connection with the illegal TKP / ML - TIKKO ( ORG / Marxist - Leninist – Turkish Workers ' and ORG ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG replied to the Governor that they would not comply with the request since none of these CARDINAL persons had prior convictions which would ban them from founding or becoming a member of an association , as provided by section QUANTITY and section QUANTITY of LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE respectively , ORG informed the applicants that a prosecution had been initiated against them for non - compliance with section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL , but that no court proceedings would be initiated if they paid a fine of MONEY ( TRL ) per person within DATE . The applicants did not pay the fine within DATE as required by the payment order .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , on DATE ORG filed a bill of indictment against the applicants and the other members of ORG . The public prosecutor requested that the accused be fined under LAW and LAW for their failure to comply with the LOC Governor 's request . The bill of indictment was not notified to the applicants .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , without holding a hearing , found the applicants and the other co - accused guilty as charged and , by a penal order ( ceza kararnamesi ) , fined them TRL CARDINAL per person . In doing so , the court relied on the “ simplified procedure ” stipulated in LAW for relatively minor offences .
CARDINAL . The applicants and the other co - accused lodged an objection with ORG against the decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the objection without a hearing .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicants paid the amounts due .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , on DATE CARDINAL of the co - accused , Mr GPE , applied to ORG , requesting the Minister to refer the case to ORG by way of a written order ( yazılı emir ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Minister of ORG issued a written order and instructed ORG at ORG to ask ORG to set aside the judgment concerned .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of ORG dated DATE and the case file was remitted to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held a preparatory hearing and included the case in its list . It further decided to summon all of the defendants , including the applicants , to its next hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE respectively , the court held CARDINAL hearings .

CARDINAL . At its last hearing , held on DATE , ORG held that it lacked jurisdiction to hear the case because , following the promulgation of Law no . CARDINAL on DATE , the sentence imposed on the applicants for not complying with the Izmir Governorship 's order had been classified as an administrative fine . During the proceedings , none of the defendants made submissions to the court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG . The case file was sent to the Governorship of GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG , together with several local non - governmental organisations ( NGOs ) , took part in a civil society movement called the “ Platform of Conscientious Objectors to War ” and made a collective press declaration in protest against the military operations of GPE ( GPE ) in GPE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the prosecutor notified the second applicant that a prosecution had been initiated against her under LAW for her involvement with the “ Platform of Conscientious Objectors to War ” , an organisation without any lawful status . The prosecutor also informed the applicant that no court proceedings would be initiated if she paid a fine of GPE CARDINAL within DATE .

CARDINAL . In the absence of payment , the prosecutor filed an indictment on DATE , charging the second applicant and CARDINAL other board members of the ORG with a violation of LAW of the LAW . In the indictment , the prosecutor stated that the platform had no legal basis under NORP law . The bill of indictment was not served on the second applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , following the simplified procedure and thus without a hearing , convicted the second applicant as charged ( case no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . By issuing a penal order , it sentenced her to an increased fine of GPE CARDINAL . However , the court suspended the sentence pursuant to section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL on the execution of sentences .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant lodged an objection with ORG against the penal order . She argued that her conviction infringed her right to freedom of expression and that “ a collective press declaration ” could not be classified as a contribution to the establishment of an unlawful organisation . She further complained that the indictment had not been communicated to her and that the court had not obtained statements or heard counter - evidence from her .
CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal court dismissed her objection , again without holding a hearing .
CARDINAL . The relevant Articles of the Code of Criminal Procedure which was in force at the time of the events read as follows :
“ Unless otherwise specifically provided by law , objection proceedings are conducted without a hearing . If necessary , the public prosecutor [ may be ] heard . ”

“ As regards infringements falling within its jurisdiction , the ... magistrates ' court makes its ruling , without holding a hearing , through a penal order . The order can only be given in cases of simple or aggravated fines or in relation to offences carrying a maximum prison sentence of DATE ... ”
“ The judge schedules a hearing if he sees an inconvenience in ruling in the absence of CARDINAL . ”
“ A hearing shall be held if an objection is raised to a prison sentence imposed by a penal order . ( ... )
The suspect can be represented by defence counsel during the hearing . ( ... )

Objections to penal orders ( ... ) are examined by a judge at the criminal court of first instance , in line with the procedure described under LAW , CARDINAL and CARDINAL . The objection would suspend the execution of the penal order . ”

CARDINAL . In a judgment given on DATE , ORG declared LAW of LAW unconstitutional and a nullity . It held that the lack of a public hearing before FAC which examines objections to penal orders would be a deprivation of the right guaranteed by LAW , as well as LAW .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , concerning references to ORG by written order of the Minister of ORG ( GPE emir ile bozma – “ the reference by written order ” ) provides :

“ Where the Minister of ORG has been informed that a judge or court has delivered a judgment that has become final without coming under the scrutiny of ORG , he may issue a formal order to ORG requiring him to ask ORG to set aside the judgment concerned ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) , which was in force at the time provided as follows :
Section CARDINAL
“ Everyone over DATE and qualified to exercise civil rights has the right to establish an association without prior notice .
However , the following persons , even if they have benefited from an amnesty , may not found an association :

CARDINAL . a ) Persons convicted of any of the following offences : shameful offences such as embezzlement , dishonesty , bribery , theft , fraud , forgery , abuse of religious belief , fraudulent bankruptcy , offences of smuggling other than for manufacturing , supply or consumption , [ or ] improper interference in official competitive tender procedures , procurements and sales .
b ) Any person convicted of those offences appearing in the first chapter of Book Two of the Turkish Penal Code , or of open incitement to commit such offences .

c ) Any person convicted of incitement to enmity and hatred on grounds of differences of class , race , language , religion or region under paragraph CARDINAL of LAW , or of counterfeiting under Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL or CARDINAL of the same code .
